adrFormatAddress: 4131 Broadway, New York, NY 10033, USA

originalText.text:
SO REGRETTING getting the Pad Thai from here. With the promise of bean sprouts and radish, there was none (it was in the menu description )?

So there was Nothing fresh and no texture that you love in a Pad Thai. Just oily and sickly sweet noodles. Not even fresh lime to cut the sweetness. Just a little container of what tastes like older lime juice or bottled. I got the topping of crispy pork and even that was stale and hard to chew (there's no chewing through the "crispy part," it's like rubber). Like NO PART of this was good?

originalText.text: Such a cute cozy atmosphere with year round fairy lights and seasonal decorations! This is my go-to place for mussaman curry, but everything I’ve tried on their menu is delicious!

text.text: Such a cute cozy atmosphere with year round fairy lights and seasonal decorations! This is my go-to place for mussaman curry, but everything I’ve tried on their menu is delicious!

originalText.text: really enjoyed everything from here it exceeded what i expected reading the descriptions. the pineapple fried rice had a really nice curry spice that complimented the vegetables and pineapple very well, never had rice like this before. the spring rolls tasted super fresh and generally had a great vegetable flavor that reminded me of dumplings. i liked the salad dressing for the papaya a lot but would've liked a little less lettuce and no green beans   it seemed a little weird. otherwise can't wait to come back!!

text.text: really enjoyed everything from here it exceeded what i expected reading the descriptions. the pineapple fried rice had a really nice curry spice that complimented the vegetables and pineapple very well, never had rice like this before. the spring rolls tasted super fresh and generally had a great vegetable flavor that reminded me of dumplings. i liked the salad dressing for the papaya a lot but would've liked a little less lettuce and no green beans   it seemed a little weird. otherwise can't wait to come back!!

originalText.text:
We visited on a weekend for brunch. The inside was surprisingly small, since I was expecting a full-on “restaurant” type eatery. It seems that most businesses they have are either pick up or delivery. They did have a couple of small tables, and a small counter seating by the window.

They have some enticing lunch special menu at great price, and our luck would have it, they offer it for brunch too! They come with complimentary side salad, a choice of starter, and a water. The water can be upgraded to Thai Iced Tea or Soda for additional cost. We got the Thai Iced Tea (additional $2 for upgrade from water). It was really good, kind of nutty, and very sweet as expected.

We had Vegetable Gyoza and Fried Tofu as starters. They were small in portion, but they are starters... Gyoza were steamed, not fried. Tofu were very firm, with a bit of kick to it from the tasty sauce.

For main, we had Massaman Curry with Fried Fillet Fish, and Street Pork Noodle Soup.  Curry was coconut-y and sweet, but not too sweet. Nice amount of rice and loads of lightly fried white fish, which was very tasty! The Noodle Soup was so good! Light with almost translucent broth and noodle, not heavy at all. Earthy and comfy, very homey and flavorful.

It was very satisfying, we were full with just a little over $20! The female staff was very friendly and welcoming also, we will be sure to return!

originalText.text: Great Thai place, pretty authentic on those funky back flavors. Thats when you know your getting a better meal. The meals have a great umami depth of flavor.  The vegetables were cooked just right, the chicken was also seasoned well and could be enjoyed all on it's own. I had another meal with the Crispy Pork Belly, it was very good as well, perfectly fried and crispy. It's a tiny shop but they are making a great meal.
